title: Authors and Citation
text: Petr Tuma. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tuma P (2022). rren: Renaissance Benchmark Data Processing Package. https://renaissance.dev/utilities-r, https://github.com/renaissance-benchmarks/utilities-r.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rren: Renaissance Benchmark Data Processing Package},   author = {Petr Tuma},   year = {2022},   note = {https://renaissance.dev/utilities-r, https://github.com/renaissance-benchmarks/utilities-r}, }

title: Renaissance Benchmark Data Processing Package
text: rren packages various functions useful processing measurements collected using Renaissance Benchmark Suite.

title: Renaissance Benchmark Data Processing Package
text: Use load_file_json () load_path_json () load measurement data tibble. functions support multiple measurement data file versions normalize basic timing columns easier processing.

title: Compute outlier flags. — identify_outliers_global
text: outlier detection method based quantiles permits retaining short tails. sample considered outlier outside interval computed (lo - range * slack, hi + range * slack) lo hi denoting limit 1 - limit quantiles range = hi - lo.

title: Compute outlier flags. — identify_outliers_global
Compute outlier flags. — identify_outliers_global
text: .data sample vector .limit quantile separates inliers outliers .slack tolerated distance limit quantile

title: Compute outlier flags. — identify_outliers_global
text: boolean vector outlier flags

title: Compute outlier flags. — identify_outliers_global
code: # An outlier gets flagged. identify_outliers_global (c (1:10, 100)) #>  [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE  # No outlier gets flagged with short tails. identify_outliers_global (1:10) #>  [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE

what: Compute outlier flags using sliding window. — identify_outliers_window
title: Compute outlier flags using sliding window. — identify_outliers_window
text: identify_outliers_global() except quantile computation performed sliding window centered sample. Currently computation really efficient runs O (n*w*log (w)) window size w.

title: Compute outlier flags using sliding window. — identify_outliers_window
Compute outlier flags using sliding window. — identify_outliers_window
text: .data sample vector .window window size samples .limit quantile separates inliers outliers .slack tolerated distance limit quantile

title: Compute outlier flags using sliding window. — identify_outliers_window
text: boolean vector outlier flags

title: Compute outlier flags using sliding window. — identify_outliers_window
code: # A sample of 100 is considered an outlier when near # different values but not when near similar values. identify_outliers_window (c (100, 15:25, 95:105, 100), .window = 10) #>  [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE #> [13] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE

what: Load data from given file. — load_file_json
title: Load data from given file. — load_file_json
text: Load data given file.

title: Load data from given file. — load_file_json
Load data from given file. — load_file_json
text: data_file data file load

title: Load data from given file. — load_file_json
text: tibble loaded data

title: Load data from given file. — load_file_json
text: basic timing columns translated canonical form: time contain individual repetition time seconds total contain aggregate execution time end repetition seconds index contain index measurement run starting 1 Additional metadata included factor columns: vm hash configuration metadata can used distinguish incompatible measurement configurations vm_name name virtual machine vm_version version virtual machine vm_configuration gives concatenated command line arguments run unique identifier run benchmark name benchmark

title: Load data from given file. — load_file_json
code: load_file_json (rren_example ('results-small-version-5.json')) #> # A tibble: 6 × 9 #>   index  time total vm_name                  vm_ve…¹ vm_co…² run   vm    bench…³ #>   <int> <dbl> <dbl> <fct>                    <fct>   <fct>   <chr> <chr> <fct>   #> 1     1  5.41  10.4 OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… page-r… #> 2     2  2.45  14.9 OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… page-r… #> 3     3  2.33  18.5 OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… page-r… #> 4     1  7.80  30.3 OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… naive-… #> 5     2  1.43  31.7 OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… naive-… #> 6     3  1.28  33.0 OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… naive-… #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​vm_version, ²​vm_configuration, ³​benchmark

text: Load data given path recursively.

title: Load data from given path recursively. — load_path_json
Load data from given path recursively. — load_path_json
text: data_path data path load pattern regular expression pattern match cache file name use data cache

title: Load data from given path recursively. — load_path_json
text: tibble loaded data

title: Load data from given path recursively. — load_path_json
code: load_path_json (rren_example (), pattern = '^results-small-version-[0-9]+\\.json$') #> # A tibble: 18 × 9 #>    index  time total vm_name                 vm_ve…¹ vm_co…² run   vm    bench…³ #>    <int> <dbl> <dbl> <fct>                   <fct>   <fct>   <chr> <chr> <fct>   #>  1     1  7.56  7.56 OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… naive-… #>  2     2  5.47 13.0  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… naive-… #>  3     3  5.20 18.2  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… naive-… #>  4     1 19.2  19.2  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… page-r… #>  5     2  2.76 21.9  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… page-r… #>  6     3  2.77 24.7  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… page-r… #>  7     1  7.91  7.91 OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… naive-… #>  8     2  5.75 13.7  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… naive-… #>  9     3  5.51 19.2  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… naive-… #> 10     1 21.7  21.7  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… page-r… #> 11     2  2.97 24.7  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… page-r… #> 12     3  2.88 27.6  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 25.332… ""      /hom… 39b0… page-r… #> 13     1  5.41 10.4  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… page-r… #> 14     2  2.45 14.9  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… page-r… #> 15     3  2.33 18.5  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… page-r… #> 16     1  7.80 30.3  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… naive-… #> 17     2  1.43 31.7  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… naive-… #> 18     3  1.28 33.0  OpenJDK 64-Bit Server … 17.0.3… ""      /hom… cec0… naive-… #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​vm_version, ²​vm_configuration, ³​benchmark

what: Preserve last samples in each run by count. — preserve_last_n
title: Preserve last samples in each run by count. — preserve_last_n
text: Useful extracting set representative samples run, assuming last part run representative. Can specify maximum share samples function preserves. Runs fewer samples removed entirely.

title: Preserve last samples in each run by count. — preserve_last_n
Preserve last samples in each run by count. — preserve_last_n
text: .data measurement results filter .n many samples taken end preserve .max_share maximum share samples preserve

title: Preserve last samples in each run by count. — preserve_last_n
text: filtered measurement results

what: Preserve last samples in each run by time. — preserve_last_sec
title: Preserve last samples in each run by time. — preserve_last_sec
text: Useful extracting set representative samples run, assuming last part run representative. Can specify maximum share samples function preserves. Runs fewer samples removed entirely.

title: Preserve last samples in each run by time. — preserve_last_sec
Preserve last samples in each run by time. — preserve_last_sec
text: .data measurement results filter .sec old samples taken end preserve .max_share maximum share samples preserve .equal_count_per_run make sample count per run equal

title: Preserve last samples in each run by time. — preserve_last_sec
text: filtered measurement results

title: Preserve last samples in each run by time. — preserve_last_sec
text: equal sample count per run requested, chosen median sample count.

text: Uses identify_outliers_global() identify outliers given column. , removes outlier rows.

title: Remove outliers. — remove_outliers_global
text: tibble rows filtered
